title: Watch: Arvind Kejriwal, Wife Dance To Pushpa Song At Daughter's Engagement
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal recently drew the Internet's attention - not for politics, but for a display of celebration.

title: "Deploy Military": Mithun Chakraborty Calls For President's Rule In West Bengal
content: Actor and BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty has urged the Centre to consider imposing President's Rule in West Bengal, citing concerns over the law and order situation in the state following a week of violence in Murshidabad district.

title: CCTV Captures Moment When Building Collapsed In Delhi's Mustafabad
content: The collapse of a four-storey building in Mustafabad in northeast Delhi has left four dead early, with rescuers now trying to pull out those feared trapped under its debris. CCTV in an adjacent alley has captured the moment the building collapsed.

title: Trump's Feud With Harvard Risks Critical Research Into Lou Gehrig's Disease
content: David Walt's project is one of many that's getting caught in the middle of what's poised to become a protracted political and legal fight over the government's ability to dictate conditions to the nation's private universities.

title: 4 Dead, Many Feared Trapped As Building Collapses In Delhi's Mustafabad
content: The four-storey building in Delhi collapsed around 3 am, following which rescue operations involving teams from the NDRF and Delhi Fire Services were launched.

title: Indian Student Killed By Stray Bullet In Canada, Was "Innocent Bystander"
content: A 21-year-old Indian student was killed in Canada after a stray bullet struck her. She was waiting at a bus stop on her way to work when the shots were fired by a car occupant.

title: Over 140 Killed, Many Missing After Boat Carrying Fuel Catches Fire In Congo
content: Hundreds of passengers were crowded onto a wooden boat on the Congo River in northwest DRC on Tuesday when the fire erupted.

title: "Everybody Out": Dr Oz's Granddaughter Faints During His Swearing-In Ceremony At Oval Office
content: White House aides sprung into action, shooing away reporters and photographers, who were covering the White House swearing-in ceremony of Mehmet Oz as Administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).

title: "Must Be Allowed To Do My Job": Trump's MS-13 Tattoo Photo Sparks Debate
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday evening shared a photograph that he claimed showed the tattooed knuckles of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man who was deported to El Salvador last month amid controversy.

title: Humanoid Robots Race With Humans At Half-Marathon In China
content: Beijing officials have described the event as more akin to a race car competition, given the need for engineering and navigation teams.

title: Italy Opens Its First 'Sex Room' In Prison For Inmates
content: The private visits for some prisoners follow a Constitutional Court ruling that recognised inmates' right to have "intimate meetings" with partners visiting from outside.

title: Former Underworld Don Muthappa Rai's Son Shot At In Karnataka
content: The incident occurred between 1 am to 1.30 am (late Friday night) near his residence when he was travelling from Bidadi to Bengaluru in his car.

title: India To Bring 8 Cheetahs From Botswana, 4 Of Them Arriving Next Month
content: Eight cheetahs will be brought to India from Botswana in southern Africa in two phases, including four by May, officials have said.

title: "No Action Is Worth Your Daughter": Anurag Kashyap's 'Apology' After Outrage
content: Acclaimed filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has waded into another controversy with his remarks on the Brahmin community.

title: Madhya Pradesh's "Fake" Doctor Sent To Jail Till May 1
content: Narendra Yadav alias N John Camm has been sent to jail till May 1. After his police remand ended, the police presented Narendra Yadav before the court in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh and was ordered to remain in judicial custody until May 1.

title: 'Innocent bystander': 21-year-old Indian student shot dead in Canada
content: Harsimrat Randhawa, a 21-year-old Indian student at Mohawk College, tragically died after being struck by a stray bullet at a Hamilton bus stop. She was an innocent bystander caught in a shootout between two vehicles. Police are investigating the homicide and appealing for public assistance with dashcam or security footage from the area.

title: Man beats neighbour’s dog for barking, drags it for 12km by car
content: Amit Sharma was arrested in Greater Noida's Dankaur. He assaulted and dragged his neighbour Sudhir Indoria's German Shepherd. The dog barked at Sharma's son, causing him to fall. Sharma then tied the dog to his car and dragged it for 10-12 km. Indoria filed a complaint, leading to Sharma's arrest. The dog is critically injured and receiving treatment.

title: 'Veteran cricketer asked to sleep with me': Anaya's bold confession
content: Anaya Bangar, daughter of Sanjay Bangar, revealed facing harassment within the cricket world after her gender-affirming surgery. She received nude photos from cricketers and faced verbal abuse, including a proposition from a former player. Anaya has represented Islam Gymkhana in Mumbai’s club circuit and also played for Hinckley Cricket Club in Leicestershire, UK.

title: Shark Tank judge Aman Gupta on Blu Smart fraud: Bachpan mein parents ne...
content: Aman Gupta addressed the BluSmart fraud, highlighting the importance of ethics and governance. He emphasized that financial mismanagement damaged trust in the startup ecosystem, causing losses for investors, founders, employees, and customers. Gupta urged entrepreneurs to prioritize clean financial records and transparent reporting over rapid growth, advocating for ethical business practices.

title: RCB captain Patidar breaks Sachin Tendulkar's record
content: Punjab Kings defeated Royal Challengers Bengaluru in a shortened IPL match. Tim David's fifty propelled RCB to 95. Josh Hazlewood took three wickets. Nehal Wadhera's 33 guided Punjab to victory. Rajat Patidar reached 1000 IPL runs quickly. He is the second-fastest Indian to achieve this feat. RCB fell to fourth place. Punjab Kings rose to second in the points table.

title: 'Reconsider travel': US revises advisory for B'desh citing crime & terrorism
content: The US State Department has reissued a travel advisory for Bangladesh, urging citizens to reconsider travel due to civil unrest, crime, and terrorism. Most of the country is at Level 3, while the Chittagong Hill Tracts remain at Level 4, citing risks of violence and kidnappings. Demonstrations continue nationwide, potentially escalating into violence.

title: Infosys fires 240 trainees: You have not … : says HR’s email
content: Infosys has recently fired 240 trainees after they failed internal assessment tests, following a similar layoff of over 300 trainees in February. The company is offering affected individuals free upskilling programs through NIIT and UpGrad, along with outplacement services. Trainees can opt for BPM industry training or IT fundamentals, with potential opportunities at Infosys BPM Limited after completion.

title: What experts say about Trump's tattoo theory to prove MS-13 gang ties
content: President Trump's reliance on tattoos to identify gang members for deportation, particularly Venezuelans, faces growing criticism. Experts warn against using tattoos as sole evidence, citing cases like Andry Jose Hernandez Romero's deportation based on innocuous tattoos.

title: Seelampur teen who was stabbed to death went out to buy food for his mother
content: In Seelampur, New Delhi, Kunal, a 17-year-old, was fatally stabbed. This incident sparked outrage among local residents. They protested, demanding justice and increased safety. The community cited rising violence and a lack of police action. Residents expressed fear and some considered leaving the area. Heavy police presence was deployed to manage the tension. The investigation is underway.

title: How JK Rowling funded a legal battle that curtailed trans rights in UK
content: JK Rowling faces scrutiny for donating £70,000 to For Women Scotland, following a UK Supreme Court ruling impacting transgender rights. The court decided trans women aren't legally women in specific contexts, sparking debate over sex-based protections. Rowling celebrated the ruling, while critics view it as a setback for transgender rights, reflecting broader global challenges.

title: Putin to students: 'You know, there's a person named Elon Musk...'
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has publicly lauded Elon Musk, comparing him to Sergei Korolev, a key figure in early Soviet space achievements. Putin admired Musk's ambitious Mars colonization goals, describing him as a visionary. This praise comes amidst heightened geopolitical tensions and scrutiny over Musk's controversial statements on global affairs, particularly regarding the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: Stillborn tossed into trash, auto driver arrested for raping minor girl
content: In Yelahanka, a man's simple act of helping a neighbor turned into a shocking ordeal when he unknowingly disposed of a bag containing a stillborn baby. The neighbor, a 17-year-old vegetable vendor, had secretly given birth after being impregnated by an autorickshaw driver. The driver has been arrested under the POCSO Act for his involvement.

title: Army orders probe after Ignou professor alleges assault by troops in J&K
content: The Army has initiated an inquiry following allegations that an IGNOU professor was assaulted by troops during a vehicle check in Rajouri district. The professor, Liaqat Ali, reportedly sustained head injuries. The Army claims Ali attempted to seize a soldier's weapon, leading to a scuffle, but assures a thorough investigation and appropriate action if misconduct is proven.

title: JEE Main scores out: NTA withholds results of 110 candidates for unfair means
content: The JEE (Main) 2025 Session 2 results have been declared, with 24 candidates achieving a perfect 100 percentile. However, the NTA has withheld the results of 110 candidates involved in unfair practices such as impersonation and document forgery. Additionally, results of 23 candidates have been kept on hold due to discrepancies in biometric and personal data. The NTA reaffirmed its commitment to transparency and urged all candidates to adhere strictly to examination rules.

title: Iran, US begin second round of nuclear talks amid high regional tensions
content: High-stakes nuclear negotiations between Iran and the United States have commenced in Rome, mediated by Oman, aiming to address Tehran's nuclear program. These discussions occur amidst heightened regional tensions, including the Israel-Hamas conflict and US airstrikes in Yemen.

title: UP Woman Who Eloped With Would-Be Son-In-Law Returns, To Live Together
content: Upon returning, the Aligarh police counselled the couple for 12 hours straight where they made Devi talk to her husband and family, officials said.

title: US Releases 10,000 Pages Of Records On Robert F Kennedy's Assassination
content: Robert F Kennedy was fatally shot on June 5, 1968, at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles moments after giving a speech celebrating his victory in California's presidential primary.

title: Students Told To Remove Sacred Thread At Karnataka Exam Centre, Case Filed
content: Authorities have initiated an investigation into the matter to determine the circumstances under which students were allegedly instructed to remove religious symbols.

title: 5 Dead After Roof Collapses In UP's Meerut: Cops
content: Five members of a family were killed when the roof of their house collapsed during a strong storm in this district on Friday evening, police said.

title: "Yemen Won't Back Down": Houthis Vow More Attacks After US Strikes Kill 74
content: Yemen's Houthis rebels have vowed to continue their military operations against Israel and the United States following deadly airstrikes on the Ras Isa oil port that killed at least 74 people, CNN reported.

title: 4 dead, several feared trapped as building collapses in Delhi's Mustafabad
content: A building collapsed in Mustafabad, Delhi early Saturday. Rescue operations are underway. Several people are feared trapped under the debris. NDRF and Delhi Police teams are at the site. The collapse follows recent heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in Delhi. Last week, a wall collapse near Madhu Vihar resulted in one death and two injuries.

title: Anurag Kashyap responds to backlash over Brahmin comment
content: Filmmaker and actor Anurag Kashyap has issued a public apology on Friday night after his controversial remark about the Brahmin community sparked widespread outrage. The comment was made amid the ongoing Phule controversy, and drew sharp criticism across social media platforms. Taking to Instagram, Kashyap shared a detailed note addressing the backlash and the threats received by his loved ones.

title: Shreyas Iyer: 'Personally, I had a chat with Chahal'
content: Punjab Kings defeated Royal Challengers Bengaluru by five wickets in a rain-shortened IPL match, climbing to second place in the points table. RCB, batting first, managed 95 for nine, with Tim David scoring a quickfire 50. Punjab chased the target efficiently, led by Nehal Wadhera's 33, despite Josh Hazlewood's impressive bowling.

title: JEE Main result toppers list: 24 candidates score 100% across states
content: The JEE (Main) 2025 Session 2 results have been declared by NTA at jeemain.nta.nic.in. A total of 24 students secured 100 percentile, with Rajasthan contributing the highest number of toppers. The results reflect combined performance across January and April sessions, with the best score considered. NTA also released category-wise cut-offs for JEE (Advanced) 2025 eligibility. Candidates can access their scorecards online, while Paper 2A and 2B results will be announced separately.

title: Fire breaks out in Prayagraj tent supplier warehouse
content: A fire erupted early Saturday in a Prayagraj warehouse storing tenting materials used for the recent Maha Kumbh. Located in the Parade Ground area, the blaze prompted a swift response, with six water tenders deployed and reinforcements arriving. While no casualties were reported, nearby worker Rahul described hearing cylinder explosions.

title: As trade deficit mounts, China 'ready' to import premium goods from India
content: Amid trade tensions, China is seeking stronger ties with India, offering to boost Indian exports to address the trade deficit. Ambassador Xu Feihong hopes India will provide a fair environment for Chinese businesses. China welcomes PM Modi to the SCO summit, emphasizing dialogue for a stable relationship. Both nations aim to resolve border issues peacefully, focusing on mutual development.

title: RCB create unwanted IPL record, become first team to ...
content: In a rain-curtailed IPL match, Punjab Kings defeated Royal Challengers Bengaluru by five wickets at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. Tim David's aggressive half-century helped RCB post a modest 95/9. Nehal Wadhera's composed innings guided PBKS to victory in 12.1 overs, despite Hazlewood's impressive bowling. The defeat marked RCB’s third consecutive loss at home this season, continuing a worrying trend for the Bengaluru-based franchise.

title: Thousands of RFK documents declassified under Trump executive order
content: The Trump administration has released 10,000 pages of classified documents related to Senator Robert F. Kennedy's 1968 assassination, fulfilling a promise of transparency. RFK's son, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., welcomed the release, expressing hope for restored trust in government. The documents, available on the National Archives website, include FBI and Justice Department memos, potentially reigniting public debate about the assassination.

title: Building crumbles, dust clouds rise: Delhi building collapse caught on video
content: In Delhi's Mustafabad, an under-construction six-floor building collapsed around 2:30 am on Saturday, resulting in at least four fatalities. Triggered by a dust storm and heavy rains, the incident prompted a large-scale rescue operation by NDRF, Delhi Police, and local authorities. Investigations are underway to determine if structural violations or negligence contributed to the collapse.

title: Confirmed: Long delayed Nasa-Isro’s joint mission ‘NISAR’ to launch in June
content: India's space program is set for significant milestones with the confirmed launch of the NASA-ISRO NISAR satellite in June 2025, designed to monitor Earth's surface changes. Furthermore, Indian Air Force Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will journey to the International Space Station as part of Axiom Mission 4, conducting crucial research in microgravity and marking a new era for Indian astronauts.

title: Canada elections explained: Who’s running, who can vote, why it matters
content: Canadians are preparing to vote on April 28, deciding between the Liberal Party, led by Mark Carney, and the Conservative Party under Pierre Poilievre. The election will determine the country's direction on key issues like climate policy, economic resilience, and relations with the US and India.

title: JEE Main 2025 session 2 results declared: Check cut-offs here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the JEE Main 2025 Session 2 results for Paper 1 on jeemain.nta.nic.in. Out of over 14.75 lakh candidates who appeared, 24 secured a perfect 100 percentile, with Rajasthan producing the highest number of toppers. Cut-off scores for JEE Advanced eligibility were also announced. The exam saw over 93% attendance and was conducted across 531 centres with strict security measures to ensure fairness and transparency.

title: Hindu leader abducted, beaten to death in Bangladesh
content: In Bangladesh's Dinajpur, Bhabesh Chandra Roy, a Hindu community leader, was allegedly abducted and killed. Roy, vice-president of the Biral unit of Bangladesh Puja Udjapan Parishad, received a phone call before being taken from his home by four men. He was reportedly beaten in Narabari village and later found unconscious near his residence.

title: Trump cut off mid-Iran comments as child faints during Dr Oz ceremony
content: Dr Mehmet Oz's swearing-in ceremony as CMS administrator was abruptly halted when a young girl, later identified as a family member, collapsed during a White House press briefing. The incident occurred shortly after Oz took the oath of office, administered by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr, with President Trump in attendance.

title: 'My son didn’t deserve to die like this': Seelampur teen’s murder sparks protest
content: In a shocking incident in northeast Delhi's Seelampur, 17-year-old Kunal was fatally stabbed in a suspected revenge killing. Police are hunting for two teenage suspects and have arrested Zikra, accused of abetting the crime. The murder is linked to a previous stabbing incident, with the suspects allegedly seeking retribution against Kunal.

title: Military operations crippled as ALHs continue to remain grounded
content: The Indian armed forces are facing significant operational challenges due to the grounding of approximately 330 'Dhruv' ALH helicopters, exacerbating existing shortages caused by the obsolete Cheetah and Chetak choppers. This disruption has severely impacted military operations, especially sustenance flights to forward areas and reconnaissance missions.

title: 'Half of student visas US revoked are of Indians'
content: The US faces scrutiny for its increasing visa revocations and SEVIS terminations targeting international students, disproportionately affecting Indians. AILA reports 50% of such cases involve Indian students, raising concerns about arbitrary actions. Despite a surge in Indian students pursuing US education, anecdotal evidence suggests a decline in aspirations.

title: ‘Lab leak’ theory: Trump’s new Covid site accuses Biden, Fauci of cover-up
content: The White House has relaunched its Covid-19 website, prominently featuring the lab-leak theory and accusing the previous administration of suppressing debate on the virus's origins. The updated site criticizes early pandemic responses and alleges censorship of alternative views. This move follows revised assessments from intelligence agencies, while China continues to reject the lab-leak hypothesis.

title: Kesari Chapter 2 box office collection Day 1: Akshay Kumar starrer off to slow start
content: Akshay Kumar's *Kesari Chapter 2*, depicting the aftermath of Jallianwala Bagh, debuted on April 18, 2025, garnering positive reviews but a modest Rs 7.50 crore opening. Despite high expectations fueled by the sequel advantage and Easter holiday, the film's performance aligns with Sunny Deol’s *Jaat*. The film stars R. Madhavan and Ananya Panday, coinciding with the massacre's 106th anniversary.

title: Seelampur murder: Who is Zikra? ‘Lady Don’ once bouncer for jailed gangster’s wife
content: In a shocking incident in northeast Delhi's Seelampur, 17-year-old Kunal was fatally stabbed, allegedly in a revenge killing orchestrated by 'Lady Don' Zikra, who has been arrested for conspiracy. The murder, linked to a previous stabbing incident, has ignited local protests and heightened tensions. Police are actively searching for two teenage suspects believed to be involved in the crime.

title: 'Jaat' box office collection day 9: Movie clocks in Rs 4.25 cr on 2nd Friday
content: Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari 2' released in theatres on Good Friday, April 18. The movie made Rs 7.5 crore on day 1. Meanwhile, Sunny Deol, Randeep Hooda starrer 'Jaat' made Rs 4.5 crore on second Friday.

title: Pat McAfee slammed for airing false rumour about Ole Miss student, triggers outrage
content: Pat McAfee faces criticism for sharing an unverified rumor about an Ole Miss student, Mary Kate Cornett, on his show, leading to online harassment. Cornett accuses McAfee of defamation and causing emotional distress, potentially leading to legal action.

title: Indian student dies in Texas hit-and-run; another injured
content: In a tragic hit-and-run in Denton, Texas, Vangavolu Deepthi, a 23-year-old Indian student, lost her life just before her graduation. Deepthi and her friend were struck by a speeding car; Deepthi succumbed to head injuries despite medical efforts and a crowdfunding campaign. Local police are investigating, while Deepthi's family mourns, recalling her invitation to her upcoming convocation.

title: What Trump said in first reaction on deported Maryland man linked to MS-13
content: Donald Trump defended the deportation of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, linking him to MS-13 with a photo of a tattooed hand. This sparked controversy after images surfaced of Abrego Garcia with Senator Chris Van Hollen in El Salvador. Despite a court order blocking his removal, Abrego Garcia was deported, leading to accusations of due process violations.

title: Judge orders Tufts Student detained in Louisiana must be returned by May 1
content: A Turkish student from Tufts University, detained in Louisiana over an opinion piece criticizing the university's stance on Palestinian issues, must return to New England by May 1 for a hearing. A federal judge ordered the transport to assess the legality of her detention.

title: Tahawwur Rana disclosures may prompt NIA to re-examine Headley
content: Following Tahawwur Hussain Rana's extradition, NIA is interrogating him about the 26/11 attacks and David Headley's role. Rana's disclosures may lead to NIA seeking further access to Headley, currently jailed in the US. Headley, according to former home secretary G K Pillai, was Rana's key link to the conspiracy, updating him on LeT's plans and reconnaissance.

title: 4 sheds, 3 crores, 2 nations, 1 dream: Story of India Aryabhata
content: In 1975, India launched its first satellite, Aryabhata, from a Soviet cosmodrome, marking a pivotal moment in its space program. Despite challenges and limited resources, a dedicated team of Indian scientists built the satellite in just 30 months.

title: IPL: Wadhera proves decisive in steering PBKS over the line against RCB
content: In a bowler-dominated match, Nehal Wadhera's crucial unbeaten 33 propelled Punjab Kings to victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru, inflicting their third home defeat. Tim David's unbeaten fifty helped RCB reach 95/9 in a rain-shortened game, but Wadhera's aggressive hitting against Hazlewood and Sharma turned the tide, securing PBKS's climb to second place in the points table.

title: Ja plays through injury, leads Grizz into playoffs
content: Ja Morant, playing with a sprained right ankle, scored 22 points, and the Grizzlies rolled past the Mavericks 120-106 to secure the No. 8 seed in the Western Conference playoffs.

title: 'Battle-tested' Heat make play-in history as 10-seed
content: The Heat regrouped after losing an early lead to beat the Hawks 123-114 on Friday night and make NBA play-in tournament history.

title: Source: Popovich out of hospital after incident
content: Spurs coach Gregg Popovich was taken to a hospital after an incident at a restaurant Tuesday but is now home and doing fine, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: 'It's just sad': Luka weighs in on Harrison's talk
content: Luka Doncic says he still hasn't spoken to Nico Harrison since being traded to the Lakers -- but has heard what the Mavericks GM has said in justifying his reasoning for the deal.

title: Cubs blow lead in 10-run 8th, storm back in thriller
content: In a wild affair at Wrigley, the Cubs outslugged the Diamondbacks 13-11 on Friday in the first nine-inning game in MLB history in which both teams scored 10 or more runs from the seventh inning on.

title: QB Browne returns to Purdue after brief UNC stint
content: Quarterback Ryan Browne has decided to transfer back to Purdue after joining North Carolina earlier this offseason.

title: First-time father-to-be Ohtani away from Dodgers
content: Manager Dave Roberts said before the Dodgers' series opener Friday night against the Rangers in Texas that Shohei Ohtani was with his wife and going on MLB's paternity list. He can miss up to three games.

title: Raiders GM Spytek strong believer in drafting RB
content: Raiders general manager John Spytek said he is a strong believer in taking running backs high in the draft, but added that he is "open-minded" to taking a quarterback.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs mega-preview: Championship cases, X factors, bold predictions for all 16 teams
content: The postseason Thunderdome is about to open its gate. Which team will emerge as the 2025 Stanley Cup champion?

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the 2025 playoffs: The NHL's second season begins
content: Miss anything the past six months? Miss EVERYTHING? Here are the top teams, players, matchups and more.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: ‘I’ll beat you tomorrow for $10k’: Inside the secret world of MLB pickleball
content: Here's how the pickleball court is replacing the golf course as where the baseball world gets away from the game.

title: A roller coaster of a day: The highs and lows of NCAA gymnastics semifinals
content: The NCAA gymnastics semifinals were as wild as predicted, with major upsets to both No. 1 LSU and No. 3 Florida.

title: Bill Belichick's new book underscores the importance of personal connections
content: Bill Belichick's new book, "The Art of Winning: Lessons from My Life in Football," highlights the role relationships play in the sport.

title: Crew expect record crowd for Messi in Cleveland
content: Columbus Crew is expecting a record crowd when it hosts Lionel Messi and Inter Miami, after moving the game to Cleveland.

title: Sources: Man Utd eye Dibling if they win Europa
content: Manchester United will step up their interest in Southampton midfielder Tyler Dibling if they secure UCL qualification, sources have told ESPN.

title: Wrexham promotion hopes dented after draw
content: Wrexham's bid for a third straight promotion took a hit when the Welsh side drew with Bristol Rovers 1-1 and slipped one spot into third place Friday.

title: LAFC boss Cherundolo to step down at end of '25
content: LAFC head coach Steve Cherundolo will step down from his role at the end of the 2025 season, the MLS club announced Friday.

title: Pep: Missing UCL could hurt City transfer plans
content: Pep Guardiola has warned that Manchester City could miss out on their top transfer targets if they fail to qualify for the Champions League.

title: Ex-Jazz owners buy RSL, Utah Royals for $600M
content: The Larry H. Miller Family, in conjunction with Miller Sports & Entertainment, has acquired a controlling interest in MLS side Real Salt Lake and the NWSL's Utah Royals.

title: Amorim: United need young players vs. Wolves
content: Ruben Amorim has admitted it's not the right time to throw Manchester United's young players into Premier League action, but says he may be forced to take risks as he prioritises the Europa League.

title: The long fight ahead for boxing's Heather Hardy
content: The former boxing champ uses her brain injury to call for systemic changes to improve the health and education of fighters.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to WrestleMania 41: John Cena thinks you're awful
content: As a service to fans who have a general interest in WWE, we're happy to provide this WrestleMania 41 FAQ.

title: Former champion Julio Cesar Chavez Jr. is the right opponent for Jake Paul
content: Chavez's best day are in his rearview mirror, but this matchup is a big step up in competition for Paul.

title: Champions League semifinal predictions: Arsenal or PSG? Barcelona or Inter Milan?
content: We're down to the final four in Europe's top club competition, so who do we think has the power, talent and grit to reach the final? Our writers make their picks.

title: MLS, Saudi Arabia or another club in Europe: What's next for Kevin de Bruyne?
content: Premier League superstar Kevin De Bruyne will be a free agent soon as Man City opted not to renew him. So, with MLS and Saudi interest, what will he do next?

title: Carroll hits 35 homers? Soderstrom hits 50? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Actor Shine Tom Chacko appears before Kochi City police for questioning in hotel drug raid incident
content: Police have reportedly prepared a detailed questionnaire of 30-odd questions, including why Shine Tom Chacko fled a hotel in Kochi upon seeing the police team on Wednesday night

title: School teacher suspended after video of him offering alcohol to students goes viral in Madhya Pradesh
content: Taking cognisance of the video, district collector Dilip Kumar Yadav directed the district education officer OP Singh to take action against the teacher, the official said.

title: Tamil Nadu’s installed power capacity increases by 3,000 MW this year
content: Total capacity stands at 42,772 MW against last year’s 39,806 MW; State expects to have multiple power projects up and running by year-end

title: Fire breaks out in Prayagraj tent supplier warehouse
content: He added water tenders were rushed to the spot and efforts were underway to bring the blaze under control

title: Rana Pratap, Shivaji Maharaj are national heroes, not Aurangzeb: Rajnath Singh
content: ‘Those who feel that Aurangzeb was a hero should have read Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, who wrote that the Mughal emperor was a bigot, cruel ruler,’ said Rajnath Singh, adding ‘Both Rana Pratap and Shivaji Maharaj were not anti-Muslim’

title: West Bengal Governor Bose to visit violence-hit areas of Murshidabad on April 19
content: Before starting his journey to Shamsherganj, Mr. Bose will speak to some members of the affected families at the guest house in Farakka where he has been staying since Friday night, the official said

title: Med City proposed in 50 acres of land near airport in Rajamahendravaram
content: IMA is expected to submit a feasibility report soon; plans are afoot to shift around 250 hospitals and clinics out of the city to the new facility

title: Mumbai police nab dentist from Kolkata for trafficking; rescue two children
content: A team from the Wadala Truck Terminus police station apprehended the accused, Reshma Santosh Kumar Banerjee, last week and rescued a two-year-old boy and a three-year-old girl in the operation

title: Old techniques revived to restore Srikalahasti temple’s grandeur
content: A unique restoration effort that blends age-old techniques with new analytics promises a lasting solution to Srikalahasti temple’s persistent roof leaks and, in the process, offers a vista into how renovation of ancient structures without factoring in their construction styles can lead to more harm

title: Tension in Kuppam town as rowdy-sheeter ‘murders’ 63-year-old mechanic
content: Chittoor Superintendent of Police orders deployment of additional forces in Kuppam to prevent any untoward incident

title: Political parties continue to spar over cow deaths at TTD dairy farm
content: BJP spokesperson calls it ‘baseless allegation’ while Bhumana alleges bid to muzzle his freedom of expressing the truth; TTD releases cattle death counts reported at the farm in 2024-25 financial year

title: Anantapur and Sathya Sai districts will become a hub of solar energy, say Ministers
content: 20 lakh new solar connections have been approved across Andhra Pradesh under the PM Surya Ghar scheme, says Ravi Kumar

title: Youth electrocuted at mango orchard in Shamshabad
content: According to the police, Chetan Reddy entered the orchard and inadvertently came into contact with an exposed transformer wire situated near the compound wall

title: Eight cheetahs to be brought to India from Botswana; first four to arrive in May
content: Forest officials informed that there are 26 cheetahs at Kuno National Park, including 16 in the open forest and 10 in the rehabilitation centre (enclosures)

title: Pakistan Navy's plan to hold naval exercise off Trincomalee scrapped following India's concerns
content: The Pakistani Navy operates in close cooperation with China's PLA Navy and New Delhi has reasons to have concerns over any visit by Pakistani warships to Trincomalee

title: Four dead, 14 rescued as building collapses in Delhi's Mustafabad
content: Fourteen people were rescued, but four among them succumbed...It was a four-storey building...The rescue operation is underway. 8-10 people are still feared trapped, says Sandeep Lamba, Additional DCP North East District

title: AP-Transco executing 55 transmission projects worth ₹4,965 crore, says Chief Secretary
content: The AP-Transco is in the process of integrating advanced technologies to improve real-time monitoring, efficiency and minimise energy losses, says Vijayanand

title: U.K. top court’s definition of woman further polarises debate on gender
content: The court unanimously ruled that only biological women meet the legal definition of a woman; the judges counselled against reading the judgment as a triumph for one or more groups at the expense of another; trans supporters, however, worry that the ruling is a setback for trans inclusion

title: Elaborate arrangements being made for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Andhra Pradesh on May 2
content: The Prime Minister is scheduled to kick off the capital construction works in Amaravati; government constitutes organising committee with six Ministers to look after the arrangements

title: Vice-President’s remarks on judiciary unacceptable, says CPI leader
content: CPI state secretary K. Ramakrishna said that it was unfortunate that Mr. Dhankhar, who holds a constitutional post, made direct comments ‘attacking the judiciary’

title: In Bengal’s Murshidabad, scars from a communal fire
content: On April 11 and 12, protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, in Murshidabad district turned violent, leaving three people dead and hundreds homeless. Moyurie Som reports on the survivors and the communal fault lines that are deepening across West Bengal

title: Not allowed to attend Friday prayers, bid to pressurise me: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: The ruling National Conference (NC) took exception to the move to bar the Mirwaiz from attending Friday prayers

title: India is a main player on world stage today: IGN Chair Ambassador AlBanai
content: Tareq AlBanai, who is Kuwait’s Permanent Representative to the UN, said that India will be a major contender in the process of reforming the UNSC

title: Data-centric policing, new-age technologies must for J&K Police to end terrorism in J&K: LG Manoj Sinha
content: He was speaking at the passing out parade function of the latest batch of Basic Recruit Training Course (BRTC) of the J&K Police Constables in Ganderbal, where 438 recruits, including 86 women, completed their training

title: CGPSC case: CBI raids middlemen in Raipur, Mahasamund
content: Last November, the CBI had arrested former CGPSC chairman Taman Singh Sonwani and others, including Shravan Kumar Goyal, then Director of Shri Bajarang Power and Ispat Ltd.

title: Second edition of three-week triservice ‘future warfare course’ from April 21
content: The programme will consist of comprehensive curriculum covering specialised subjects, with the aim of the course being to align operational priorities with capabilities of the indigenous defence industry and facilitate open discussions on various facets of modern and future warfare.

title: Siddaramaiah-led government in Karnataka tops in corruption in the country, says State BJP chief
content: Referring to the recently announced State Budget, Mr. Vijayendra criticised Congress for allegedly appeasing

title: Technician arrested for sexual harassment of flight attendant at Gurugram hospital
content: The victim was allegedly sexually harassed while on a ventilator in a semi-conscious state during treatment

title: Why is Jharkhand CM taking his wife for an official trip to Sweden, Spain instead of Industry Minister, BJP asks
content: BJP’s Jharkhand chief Babulal Marandi asks in what capacity MLA Kalpana Soren is part of the delegation in place of the Industry Minister Sanjay Prasad Yadav, an RJD leader

title: Man found dead in Bengaluru blames local BJP worker and several others of harassment
content: In a video, he accused BJP Mandal president Muniraju Gowda, local councillor Bhagyamma, and her husband Srinivas, of physically assaulting him

title: Defence Secretary calls on U.K. industry to explore partnerships with Indian defence start ups
content: During his visit to London, Rajesh Kumar Singh discussed with top U.K. officials and business leaders the strengthening of collaboration in manufacturing of naval systems, drones, surveillance, defence space, and aviation.

title: Controversy plagues release of ex-R&AW chief Dulat’s book
content: The Chief Minister and The Spy had run into controversy over certain statements attributed to former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on the abrogation of Article 370, which purportedly indicated that the veteran politician had ‘privately backed’ the move

title: Jaishankar must take up U.S. visa issue with Rubio, says Congress
content: Out of the 327 visa revocation cases of international students collected by the American Immigration Lawyers Association so far, 50% are Indians, says Congress communications chief Jairam Ramesh

title: FY25 India pharma exports cross $30 billion, surge 31% in March
content: A key component of India’s trade basket, exports rose more than 9% to touch $30 billion for the first time; pharmaceuticals did not figure in the 26% U.S. tariffs, now on hold for 90 days

title: Pakistan raises Kashmir issue in Foreign Office Consultation with Bangladesh in Dhaka
content: Statement issued by the Pakistan’s MoFA informed that the two sides also ‘reaffirmed’ the need to revitalise SAARC

title: U.P. police gives clean chit to Sambhal CO over “controversial” remark
content: Complainant Amitabh Thakur says State DGP is protecting the officer in question over his controversial comments regarding Holi celebrations and Friday namaz

title: Congress launches ‘Mahila Ki Baat’ to reach out to women voters ahead of Bihar Assembly polls
content: All India Mahila Congress Committee launches “Mahila Ki Baat, Congress Ke Saath” campaign in Bihar to include women’s needs in election manifesto

title: BCI condemns attack on its co-chairman Sadashiva Reddy at his office in Bengaluru
content: BCI Chairperson Manan Kumar Mishra says the injuries suffered by Reddy are “not random injuries, these are blows aimed at silencing, at crippling, and at intimidating a senior advocate and an elected representative of legal fraternity”

title: Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh marries party Mahila Morcha leader
content: Dilip Ghosh has been considered as the most successful party president in the State and under his leadership the party won 18 of the 42 Lok Sabha seats in the State in 2019 Lok Sabha polls

title: Hindi cannot be imposed on Maharashtra students: Congress
content: Maharashtra Congress President criticises BJP for imposing Hindi, calls for respect of regional languages and cultural diversity

title: Two cheetahs to be moved from Kuno to second home at Gandhi Sagar on April 20
content: Original plan to bring new cheetahs from South Africa to Gandhi Sagar delayed, so animals are being shifted from Kuno, an official says; discussed moving cheetahs to Gujarat’s Banni Grasslands too, says Environment Minister

title: Aaditya Thackeray targets Mahayuti, warns of ‘destruction in the name of development’
content: The Shiva Sena (UBT) hit out at the approval granted for the Gargai dam project in Palghar, claiming it would lead to the cutting of nearly five lakh trees to supply 450 MLD of water to Mumbai

title: No GST on UPI transactions over ₹2,000, clarifies government
content: Finance Ministry says reports that said that the government is considering levying GST on UPI transactions over ₹2,000, are completely false, misleading, and without any basis.

title: CBI takes over case of Chhattisgarh ex-bureaucrats, former AG influencing NAN-scam probe
content: The alleged scam pertained to procurement of sub-standard rice and salt by NAN, Chhattisgarh’s nodal agency for procuring and distributing food grains under the Public Distribution System

title: Primary school in violence-hit Murshidabad resumes classes as tensions remain high
content: “Teachers of the school went from door-to-door convincing the guardians to let the children come to school. Many were convinced, and many students are attending regular classes,” says principal Alam

title: SHRC holds two PSIs guilty of harassing a minor rape victim’s mother, violating POCSO guidelines, slaps them with ₹50,000 fine
content: The inquiry found that despite strict guidelines from the High Court of Karnataka on handling POCSO Act cases, the accused officials violated the guidelines at every level to help the accused and their family members

title: Mahim Koliwada women SHGs to receive Food Safety Training certificate
content: The certificate will be given in the presence of Deputy Chief Minister City Eknath Shinde and Food and Drug’s Cabinet Minister Narhari Zirwal on April 23

title: 51,784 vacancies in Tripura departments, Congress alleges
content: Congress announced plans to launch protests across the State to raise awareness about the discrepancies between the ruling party’s statements and the reality of the employment scenario

title: Forest department plans population study of grizzled giant squirrel in Pakkamalai and Gangavaram hills
content: The study will help the department draw up a conservation strategy by gathering the baseline data of the squirrel, an endangered species listed under Schedule I of the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972 and provide a fillip to the long-pending demand for notifying the hills as a wildlife sanctuary, say sources

title: Power supply disrupted in many areas of City, restoration work on
content: TGSPDCL disaster response teams got down to the restoration work by removing the tree branches from T&D lines to restore supply by restoring the damaged lines

title: Manipur Congress leader seeks security after rumours link him to ‘audio tapes’ case
content: The tapes, allegedly involving former Chief Minister Nongthombam Biren Singh, are related to the ethnic violence that broke out in the State in May 2023

title: BBMP introduces within property tax payment system an option for declaration of bulk waste
content: The bulk waste generators are exempted from the user fee after declaration on the property tax portal

title: Move to allot 100 acres for private hotel project near Similipal Tiger Reserve opposed
content: “The tourism project will severely impact the livelihood and religious beliefs of local tribal communities,” Rakesh Kumar Mohanty, the petitioner, alleged; proposed land lies within 700 metres of the reserve’s boundary

title: SIT probe into liquor scam: Kasireddy Rajashekar Reddy alone can spill the beans, says Vijaya Sai Reddy
content: The former Rajya Sabha member attends investigation, says he has been questioned on liquor policy, kickbacks, sale of NDPL, new liquor companies, and other issues

title: Civilian ‘thrashed’ by Army officer during search operations in Rajouri; Army orders inquiry
content: The Army ordered an inquiry on April 18 following an outcry, even as it claimed that there was an attempt of ‘weapon snatching’ by the victim

title: Tejashwi is the CM face of the Mahagathbandhan: Manoj Jha
content: Mr. Jha’s assertion comes a day after Mr. Yadav was appointed head of the INDIA coordination committee; welcomes SC direction on Waqf amendments, slams Bihar CM for compromising on issue

title: Muthukur to be developed as a model village under P4
content: Adani group to focus on the areas of renewable energy, sanitation, education and empowerment in the village

title: KEA to bar candidates who get seats in prestigious medical and technical institutions from CET counselling
content: In a suspected scam last year, Internet Protocol addresses of students were misused to block engineering seats in prestigious private colleges

title: Field-level officers asked to reach out to villages and improve policing
content: Tiruchi SP asks officers serving at the police stations to hold periodic meetings with village vigilance awareness committees and keep a tab on the movements of rowdies

title: Four-year old boy dies at Kerala’s Konni elephant camp after concrete pillar falls on him
content: The accident was caused by one of the pillars installed as part of the beautification of the elephant camp. Police said the pillar was not properly secured

title: Is a US recession coming? 5 key questions answered
content: Zodiac signs who often find love after marriage Too Cute to Handle! Janani's delightful pictures 10 habits of parents that secretly boosts children’s confidence Saree Looks of Rukhsar Rehman That Radiate Grace and Glamour Radiant pictures of actress Priyanka Mohan Times when Priya Prakash Varrier sizzled in sequined outfits 10 healthy dips to make snacks more nutritious Signs zinc, magnesium and calcium are your body's immediate priorities Low-key suit sets to steal from Sai Pallavi’s closet Pooja Hegde Embraces Vintage Vibes with Saree Sophistication Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: 50 years of Aryabhata: Satellite that launched India’s space journey
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‘Jewel Thieves’ scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There’s always a story, one just has to find it. Read More

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye Morgan Gibbs-White from Nottingham Forest
content: Antony explains how his move to real Betis helped him escape personal problems he was having in Manchester . manchester city are frontrunners to sign winger Morgan Gibbs-White this summer . city could face competition from liverp and real madrid if they win Europa League .

title: What's behind this stifling, confusing LeBron-led Lakers defense
content: the lakers had defeated the Knicks 128-112 behind a stout defensive effort . a box score offered clues at how they'd done it . the next game, 122-97 win over the Clippers, offered more evidence .

title: Spring transfer portal: Recapping news, rumors and analysis from Day 1
content:
Pete Thamel tells Pat McAfee that Nico Iamaleava is unlikely find a situation where he gets his asking price through the portal. (1:17) College football 's spring transfer portal period opened Wednesday and runs through April 25. More than  2,700 players  have elected to transfer this offseason. This period is the last chance for underclassmen to switch teams before the start of the 2025 season and for schools to bolster their roster. The biggest news of the spring period happened this past weekend when  Tennessee   parted ways  with quarterback  Nico Iamaleava . The former four-star recruit, who threw 19 touchdown passes in 2024, was seeking an increase in his  NIL package . He is now looking for a new home, and  UCLA is in the hunt . With players officially able to enter their names in the portal, we tracked all the latest news and developments. Here's a look at how Day 1 unfolded.  Transfer portal coverage: 
 Best available player rankings
